sentences.text: Dear Stockholder:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I hope you will join Noble Energys Board of Directors, executive management team, employees and alumni at our 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The attached Notice of Annual Meeting of Stockholders and Proxy Statement will serve as your guide to the business to be conducted at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 was a year of outstanding operational, financial and safety performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It was also one of great progress on our strategic objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Collectively these results have positioned us to deliver top tier long-term stock performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors and executive team are committed to providing you with information about the Company in a manner that is easy to access and understand.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Proxy Statement is a good example, providing a summary at the beginning that highlights our business and executive compensation program using charts and other graphic depictions we feel may be helpful.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This year we have continued our efforts to eliminate redundancy within the document and make it more reader-friendly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Discussion and Analysis that begins on page 37 describes our executive compensation program and shows how our executives compensation remains linked to performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You will also find discussions of the qualifications of our director candidates, and why we believe they are the right people to represent you, starting on page 11.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote is important to us and our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to the meeting, I encourage you to sign and return your proxy card, or use telephone or Internet voting, so that your shares will be represented and voted at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instructions on how to vote are found beginning on page 63.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I hope to see you at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thank you for being a stockholder and for your support of Noble Energy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: March 2, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Houston, Texas

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tuesday, April 25, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Meeting of Stockholders of NOBLE ENERGY, INC. (the Company) will be held on Tuesday, April 25, 2017 at 9:30 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Central time at Four Seasons Hotel, 1300 Lamar Street, Houston, Texas 77010, for the following purposes:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. to elect the 10 nominees as members of the Board of Directors of the Company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. to ratify the appointment of the independent auditor by the Companys Audit Committee;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. to approve, in an advisory vote, executive compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. to approve, in an advisory vote, the frequency of stockholder vote on executive compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. to approve the 2017 Long-Term Incentive Plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6. to consider a stockholder proposal requesting a published assessment of climate change policy impacts, if properly presented at the meeting; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7. to transact such other business as may properly come before the meeting and any adjournment or postponement thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors set February 24, 2017 as the record date for the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This means that holders of record of shares of the Company's common stock as of the close of business on that date are entitled to receive this notice of the meeting and vote at the meeting and any adjournment or postponement of the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A complete list of stockholders will be available for examination at our Company's offices in Houston, Texas during ordinary business hours for a period of 10 days prior to the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This list will also be available to stockholders at the meeting.

sentences.text: 2016 Business Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 was a year of outstanding operational, financial and safety performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It was also one of great progress on our strategic objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among our accomplishments, we:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: delivered a year-over-year volume increase of approximately 18%, resulting in record total sales volumes of 420 thousand barrels of oil equivalent per day;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: realized reductions in organic capital expenditures of over 45% from 2015 (excluding the impact of the Rosetta merger), while delivering 7.5% higher production for 10% less capital than our original 2016 plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: closed the sale of 3.5% working interest in Tamar for $431 million pre-tax, generating cash proceeds of $316 million after-tax;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: replaced 192% of production with organic reserve additions (including performance revisions) at less than $5/Boe replacement cost, supported by increased recovery in each onshore area;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: optimized our U.S. onshore portfolio by increasing our Delaware (Permian) Basin position with an acreage acquisition and improving our DJ Basin position through an acreage exchange;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: dissolved our Marcellus Shale joint venture, providing increased flexibility to focus on our highest return opportunities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: demonstrated our continued project execution proficiency, successfully starting up our Gunflint project in the Gulf of Mexico within budget;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reduced outstanding debt by $850 million and exited the year with $5.2 billion in liquidity;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: realized significant reductions from 2015 in unit costs for lease operating and general and administrative expenses;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: received net cash proceeds of $299 million from the issuance of Noble Midstream Partners LP common units upon its initial public offering;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: continued to advance our world-class Leviathan project toward sanction by securing marketing contracts, working with the Israeli government in its implementation of its natural gas framework, optimizing project design and significantly reducing estimated development costs;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: worked with stakeholders and other industry leaders on a constitutional amendment approved by Colorado voters in November that is expected to provide onshore regulatory stability for responsible oil and natural gas development in the state; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: set a new Company safety performance record for Company-contractor Lost Time rate and a Recordable rate consistent with 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ii
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our total stockholder return for 2016 was positive at 17%; however, we ended the year at the lower end of our peer group, coming off a top tier finish in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Despite this disappointing relative total stockholder return, our Compensation Committee believes that the Company made substantial progress toward restructuring and repositioning its portfolio to enable delivery of top tier long-term performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Executive Compensation Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued Focus on Pay for Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program is described in our Compensation Discussion and Analysis and is designed to attract and retain high quality individuals and link their compensation to performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016 we continued our emphasis on performance-based compensation, with 63.4% of our CEO's target compensation being performance-based as shown in the following chart.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-based 63.4% Other 36.5%  STIP  Base Salary  Stock Options  Restricted Stock  Performance Award
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our linkage of pay with performance may be seen over the last three years, as our mixed results in 2014 led our Compensation Committee to fund our STIP at 55% of target and reduce the award values under our LTIP in early 2015 to 75% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Improved performance in 2015 resulted in a committee decision to fund our STIP at 125% of target and return our LTIP awards in early 2016 to target level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our "say on pay" stockholder votes for 2014 and 2015 support our approach, at 97.9% and 95.4% favorability, respectively, of shares voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 was a year of outstanding operational, financial and safety performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It was also one of great progress on our strategic objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We exceeded the targets under our STIP quantitative component metrics for sales volumes, free cash
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: flow, cash costs per Boe and relative cash costs, but not relative total stockholder return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also saw favorable results under the plan's qualitative component metrics including strategic initiatives, EH&S performance, absolute total stockholder return, weighted average program rate of return and reserve additions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee concluded that these results demonstrated significant progress toward positioning the Company to deliver future top tier long-term stock performance and, against the backdrop of our disappointing relative total stockholder return versus our peers, approved 2016 STIP funding at 140% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity awards under our LTIP in early 2017 were made at target value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: iii
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Looking forward, we continue to believe that our STIP design should focus on motivating the entire organization to achieve operational and financial results that take into account the Company's strategy and operating budget and the current business environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2017, we re-evaluated our STIP considering the potential application of other returns or growth-based metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We adjusted the emphasis of certain metrics, and the program now includes onshore drilling and completion rate of return in the quantitative component.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our long-term incentives are designed to motivate and reward executive actions that lead to Company success in any business environment, link pay and performance and align with the long-term interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance versus Key Metrics
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that several key metrics are reflective of our positive results in 2016  production sales volumes, total capital spending and controllable unit costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These areas are among those considered by our Compensation Committee in determining payout under our STIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As these metrics show, the Company has been increasing production sales volumes while reducing controllable unit costs and capital spending.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are also including a chart reflecting five-year total stockholder return, which assumes a $100 investment in our common stock on December 31, 2011 and compares the total stockholder return of our common stock to that of the median of our peer group, with dividends reinvested quarterly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the required chart showing our total stockholder return compared to our peer group based on weighted market capitalization, please see our Annual Report on Form 10-K.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: *Includes sales from equity method investees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: *Excludes transaction-related acquisition costs, including the Rosetta merger in 2015 and the dissolution of the Marcellus JV in 2016..

sentences.text: All rights reserved.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For additional information about our 2016 performance, please see our Annual Report on Form 10-K.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target versus Realizable Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chart below illustrates how our executive compensation program delivers strong alignment with Company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 was Mr. Stover's second full year as CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In setting his compensation for the year our Compensation Committee considered his tenure, scope of responsibilities and level of performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Target bars represent Mr. Stovers base salary, target STIP opportunity and grant-date target value of LTIP awards for 2014, 2015 and 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Realizable bars represent, as a percentage of target, the total of each year's base salary paid, STIP earned and paid and LTIP award value as of December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Stover's 2016 LTIP award had an intended grant-date target value of $6.9 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the Company's stock price at December 31, 2016, the value of this award at that time was approximately $4.2 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By design, our executive compensation program will not deliver its intended targeted value unless the stock price appreciates on an absolute basis, the Company meets or exceeds median industry stock performance, and the Company meets or exceeds important financial and operating objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: v
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Enhancements to our Executive Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee reviewed the quantitative and qualitative components of our STIP to ensure that the metrics, targets, objectives and weighting for 2017 continue to link pay to performance with:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the quantitative component to remain weighted at 60% and allocated 15% to free cash flow1,10% each to production sales volumes, cash costs per unit of sales volumes and relative cash costs per unit of revenue, and 15% for a new metric for onshore drilling and completion rate of return that allows us to increase our focus on capital efficiency; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the qualitative component to remain weighted at 40%, to generally consider, without specific weighting, execution of strategic initiatives, safety and environmental performance, absolute stockholder return, weighted average program rate of return and reserve additions/exploration performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lead Independent Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chairman and Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board has historically combined the role of chairman of the board with the role of CEO, maintaining a separate empowered lead independent director position to strengthen our governance structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board believes this provides an efficient and effective leadership model.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Combining the two roles fosters clear accountability, effective decision-making and alignment on corporate strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have not experienced any problematic governance or management issues resulting from combining the two roles and, in this combined role, Mr. Stover has provided strategic, operational and technical expertise, vision and a proven ability to lead our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Lead Independent Director, currently Michael A. Cawley, is elected annually by our Board and has authority described in our Corporate Governance Guidelines that generally includes:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: approving the scheduling of regular and, where feasible, special meetings of the Board to ensure that there is sufficient time for discussion of all agenda items;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: consulting with the Chairman to establish, and approve, the agenda and scope of materials for each Board meeting;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: presiding  at  all  executive  sessions  of  the independent directors and Board meetings at which the Chairman is not present;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Review of Board Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board recognizes that no single leadership structure is right for all companies and at all times and that, depending on the circumstances, other leadership models, such as a separate independent chairman of the board, might be appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: serving as a liaison between the Chairman and the independent directors and coordinating the activities of such directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: coordinating the agenda for, and moderating, sessions of the Boards independent directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to review at our Board's annual organizational meeting, our Board will review, at least annually, the continued  appropriateness  of  the  combined chairman/CEO structure, as opposed to a split role or other structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All such reviews will occur outside the presence of the Chairman and CEO, at a meeting of the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee and/or at an executive session of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: facilitating  communications  among  the  other members of the Board; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: consulting with the chairs of the Board committees and soliciting their participation to avoid diluting their authority or responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board and Committees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, our Board held 15 meetings and its committees held 20 meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Development and Succession Planning
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board plays a key role in the oversight of the Companys business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are committed to ensuring that it represents a diversity of qualifications, attributes, skills and experience necessary to our future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We recognize that the investing community is interested in board tenure, diversity and governance  all areas of consideration in our Board succession planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We know that the most successful boards, like their executive management team counterparts, are ones with the collective chemistry, strength, agility and strategic perspective to meet the challenges of the fast- moving global business environment within which we operate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In our view, our current Board possesses these traits, and we have taken a number of steps to position it for the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: First, we have placed a greater emphasis on understanding governance trends, with our Governance Committee holding periodic discussions on the topic based on information provided by inside and outside experts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Second, consistent with this emphasis, we have expanded  our  outreach  under  our  stockholder engagement program, in 2016 visiting with stockholders representing approximately 38% of our stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also met with representatives of proxy advisor Glass Lewis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These meetings were invaluable in providing validation of our practices in some areas, while identifying areas for improvement in others.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, we received positive feedback on our implementation of proxy access and our continued efforts to enhance our public disclosures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also received suggestions to improve our efforts and disclosures on Board strategy, process and succession planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Third, we have evolved our Board self-evaluation process to a more participative discussion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the current environment, this discussion has involved Board strategy,  succession  planning  (including  Board committee  leadership  and  membership)  and communication.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fifth, we have revisited our director compensation program to ensure its alignment with our compensation peer group, reducing the cash fee for each telephonic meeting in which a director participates from $2,000 to $1,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that this change is consistent with overall peer company practices and, with an increase in the number of special telephonic meetings over the past three years, recognizes the cost efficiency that they provide.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fourth, we have amended our By-Laws to reduce the age at which a director would not stand for election from 75 to 72.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that this will facilitate a more orderly succession process that provides for the periodic infusion of new directors and the diversity of their perspectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Governance Committee believes that the minimum qualifications for serving as a director are that a nominee demonstrate, by significant accomplishment in his or her field, an ability to make a meaningful contribution to our Boards oversight of our business and affairs and have an impeccable record and reputation for honest and ethical conduct in both his or her professional and personal activities.

sentences.text: Nominees for director shall be those people who, after taking into account their skills, expertise, integrity, diversity, character, judgment, age, independence, corporate experience, length of service, potential conflicts of interest and commitments (including, among other things, service on the boards or comparable governing bodies of other public or private companies, charities, civic bodies or similar organizations) and other qualities, are believed to enhance our Boards ability to manage and direct, in an effective manner, our business and affairs, including, when applicable, to enhance the ability of the committees of our Board to fulfill their duties and to satisfy any independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: requirements imposed by law, regulation or listing standards of the NYSE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, nominees for director should have an understanding of the workings of large business organizations such as ours and senior level executive experience, as well as the ability to make independent, analytical judgments, the ability to be an effective communicator and the ability and willingness to devote the time and effort to be an effective and contributing member of our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our Governance Committee  will  examine  a  candidates  specific experiences and skills, time availability in light of other commitments,  potential  conflicts  of  interest,  and independence from management and our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It will also seek to have our Board represent a diversity of background,  experience,  gender  and  race.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Governance Committee annually reviews its long-term plan for Board composition, giving consideration to the foregoing factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our director compensation program consists of two principal elements: (1) annual retainer and committee fees and (2) equity, including stock options and restricted stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Governance Committee reviews our director compensation program annually, based on information provided by our independent compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors received the following cash fees for 2016, paid pro rata on a monthly basis:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: $20,000 as an annual fee for the Lead Independent Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: an annual retainer of $75,000;

sentences.text: Equity
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2005 Stock Plan for Non-Employee Directors of Noble Energy, Inc. (2005 Plan) provides for grants of stock options and awards of restricted stock to our non- employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2005 Plan expired under its own terms on March 31, 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On January 27, 2015 our Board adopted a substantially similar 2015 Stock Plan for Non-Employee Directors of Noble Energy, Inc. (2015 Plan) (together, the 2005 Plan and the 2015 Plan, the Director Plans) as a replacement, which was approved by our stockholders on April 28, 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Newly elected non-employee directors receive, on the date of initial election to our Board, an award with a total value of $250,000 to be allocated one-half to stock options and one-half to restricted stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On January 27, 2015, our Board reduced the annual equity awards for non-employee directors from a target value of $200,000 to a target value of $150,000, with one-half of that value allocated to stock options and one- half to restricted stock, in recognition of the adverse business environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It considered the Company's 2015 positive results in the same environment in making 2016 awards based on the $200,000 target value, with one- half of that value allocated to stock options and one-half to restricted stock, resulting in 9,900 stock options and 3,159 shares of restricted stock being awarded to each non-employee director, effective February 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board further considered the Company's 2016 positive results in making 2017 awards, based on the $200,000 target value, resulting in 7,541 stock options and 2,534 shares of restricted stock, effective February 1, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options are issued with an exercise price equal to the fair market value, as defined in the Director Plans, of our common stock on the date of grant and may be exercised beginning one year after the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They expire 10 years from the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted stock is restricted for a period of one year from the date of award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The vesting of stock options and restricted stock under the Director Plans is not contingent upon the satisfaction of any performance criteria and will accelerate in the event of a change of control as defined under the respective 2005 and 2015 plans or, in some cases, only upon a termination of Board membership following a change of control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the Stockholders of Noble Energy, Inc.:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary purpose of the Audit Committee of the Companys Board of Directors is to: (1) assist the Board of Directors in fulfilling its responsibility to oversee the integrity of the Companys financial statements, the Companys compliance with legal and regulatory requirements, the Independent Auditors qualifications and independence, and the performance of the Companys internal audit function and Independent Auditors and (2) prepare a committee report as required by the SEC to be included in the Companys annual proxy statement.

sentences.text: Purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Plan allows for the grant of stock options, stock appreciation rights, restricted stock, restricted stock units, performance awards, stock awards and other incentive awards to employees and other service providers of the Company and its affiliates who are in a position to make a positive contribution to the success of the Company and its affiliates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purposes of the 2017 Plan are to attract and retain highly qualified individuals to perform services for the Company and its affiliates, to further align the interests of those individuals with those of our stockholders and to more closely link compensation with Company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Plan will provide an essential component of the Companys total compensation package, reflecting the importance that we place on aligning the interests of our service providers with those of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adding to the near-term uncertainty regarding the impact of climate change  policy,  the  new  administration  and  the Republican Congress have pledged to adopt new policies aimed at increasing the production of oil and natural gas resources in the United States and repeal or amend certain executive orders and regulatory policies that have restricted or adversely impacted development.

sentences.text: We believe that taking prudent, practical and cost-effective action to reduce emissions is the right thing to do.

sentences.text: We believe that the proposal would require us to engage in speculation on matters outside our control far into the future, including the request to assess the resilience of the companys full portfolio of reserves and resources through 2040 and beyond.

sentences.text: In contrast, the proposal would have us consider risks and opportunities related not only to undeveloped proved reserves, but unproved reserves and theoretical future reserves more than twenty years into the future, and beyond.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An analysis based on the parameters set forth by the Proponent would also be speculative and risks confusing and misleading investors about our actual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We therefore do not believe that it would be in the best interest of our stockholders to expend corporate funds and time engaging in such speculative projections.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Proponent cites forecasts of the IEA; however, the main scenario in the IEAs World Energy Outlook 2016 does not forecast a reduction in global energy or oil demand through 2040.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rather, the IEAs main scenario forecasts that there will be a 30% rise in global energy demand to 2040, that global oil demand will continue to rise through 2040 to 103 million barrels per day and that the rise in electric cars (cited by the Proponent as a threat to the oil industry) will reduce 2040 global oil demand by only around 1.3 million barrels per day, or less than 1.3% of global oil demand based on the IEAs forecast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that all of the stock options and performance-based restricted shares and related cash awards granted under the 1992 Plan qualify  as  performance-based  compensation  and therefore are not subject to the deduction limitation of Section 162(m).

sentences.text: However, the salary and STIP payouts paid to our Named Executive Officers, the time-vested restricted stock awards and time-vested cash awards, and certain payments provided for under our change of control arrangements with the Named Executive Officers are not exempt from this deduction limit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Compensation Matters
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Health and Welfare Programs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We offer a number of other benefits to our executive officers pursuant to benefit programs that provide for broad-based employee participation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These benefit programs include medical, dental and vision insurance, long- and short-term disability insurance, life and accidental death and dismemberment insurance, health and  dependent  care  flexible  spending  accounts, relocation/expatriate programs and services, educational assistance, employee assistance and certain other benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In late 2014 we discontinued retiree healthcare benefits and implemented a buyout of eligible pre-age 65 active employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees who retired prior to that time and were participating in retiree medical benefits were transitioned to a defined contribution model effective as of January 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although we consider tax deductibility in the design and administration of our executive compensation plans and program, we believe that there are circumstances where our interests are best served by maintaining flexibility in the way compensation is provided, even if it results in the non-deductibility of certain compensation under the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Indemnification Agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rules under GAAP determine the manner in which we account in our consolidated financial statements for grants of equity-based compensation to our employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our accounting policies for equity-based compensation are further discussed in Note 12 to our consolidated financial statements, included in our 2016 Annual Report on Form 10-K.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have entered into an indemnification agreement with each of our non-employee directors and our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These agreements provide for us to indemnify such persons against certain liabilities that may arise by reason of their status or service as directors or executive officers and to advance their expenses incurred as a result of a proceeding as to which they may be indemnified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also cover such persons under a directors and officers liability insurance policy that we choose,  in  our  discretion,  to  maintain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These indemnification agreements are intended to provide indemnification rights to the fullest extent permitted under applicable law and are in addition to any other rights the individual  may  have  under  our  Certificate  of Incorporation, By-Laws and applicable law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe these indemnification agreements enhance our ability to attract and retain knowledgeable and experienced executive officers and non-employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Named Executive Officers are entitled to a severance payment under the plan, they would receive two weeks of pay for every year of service, not to exceed 52 weeks or be less than 12 weeks, plus a prorated STIP payment based on their STIP target percentage.

sentences.text: They would also be able to continue certain health and welfare benefits for six months at the current active employee rates.

sentences.text: Under the plan, if any of our Named Executive Officers are terminated following a change of control (other than termination for cause or by reason of death or disability), they are entitled to receive a lump sum severance payment equal to a multiplier of 2.99 for Mr. Stover, and 2.5 for Ms. Cunningham and Messrs. Fisher, Willingham and Johnson of their annual cash compensation.

sentences.text: Cash compensation for purposes of calculating severance is the sum of annual base salary and the greater of target bonus for the current year and the average STIP paid or payable for the three years prior to the change of control.

sentences.text: What is a Proxy Statement and what is a Proxy?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A proxy statement is a document that the regulations of the SEC require us to give you when we ask you to sign a proxy designating individuals to vote on your behalf.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A proxy is your legal designation of another person to vote the stock you own.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: That other person is called a proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you designate someone
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: as your proxy in a written document, that document is also called a proxy or a proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have designated two of our officers to act as proxies for the 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders: David L. Stover and Kenneth M. Fisher.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is the difference between holding shares as a stockholder of record and as a beneficial stockholder?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are registered directly in your name with our registrar and transfer agent, Wells Fargo Shareowner Services, you are considered a stockholder of record with respect to those shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held in a brokerage account or bank, you are considered the beneficial owner of those shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Proxy Statement includes free cash flow which is an important financial measure, but is not a financial measure defined by GAAP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe it is a useful tool to facilitate an understanding of the amount of cash flow generated that is available to grow our business and create long-term stockholder value, and it is used as a performance measure for purposes of our STIP.

sentences.text: NOBLE ENERGY, INC. 2017 LONG-TERM INCENTIVE PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ARTICLE I. ESTABLISHMENT AND PURPOSE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1.1    Establishment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Noble Energy, Inc., a Delaware corporation (Noble), hereby establishes the Noble Energy, Inc. 2017 Long-Term Incentive Plan for the benefit of certain officers, employees, consultants and others performing services for Noble and its Affiliates, as set forth in this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1.2    Purpose.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purposes of this Plan are to attract and retain highly qualified individuals to perform services for Noble and its Affiliates, to further align the interests of those individuals with those of the stockholders of Noble, and to more closely link compensation with the performance of Noble and its Affiliates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Noble is committed to creating long-term stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nobles compensation philosophy is based on the belief that Noble can best create stockholder value if officers, employees, consultants and others performing services for Noble and its Affiliates act and are rewarded as business owners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Noble believes that an equity stake through equity compensation programs effectively aligns service provider and stockholder interests by motivating and rewarding performance that will enhance stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1.3    Effectiveness and Term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Plan shall become effective on the later of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) the date of its adoption by the Board and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the date it is approved by the stockholders of Noble in accordance with applicable law (the Effective Date).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless terminated earlier by the Board pursuant to Section 14.1, this Plan shall terminate on the day prior to the tenth anniversary of the earlier of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) the date of its adoption by the Board and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the date it is approved by the stockholders of Noble.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) of the Code, respectively, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) with respect to other Awards, any corporation or other type of entity in a chain of corporations or other entities in which each corporation or other entity has a controlling interest in another corporation or other entity in the chain, starting with Noble and ending with the corporation or other entity that has a controlling interest in the corporation or other entity for which the Employee, consultant, or other individual provides direct services.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.8    Change of Control means the occurrence of any of the following events after the Effective Date:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a)    Individuals who, as of the Effective Date, constitute the Board (the Incumbent Board) cease for any reason to constitute at least 51% of the Board, provided that any person becoming a director subsequent to the Effective Date whose election, or nomination for election by Nobles stockholders was approved by a vote of at least a majority of the directors then comprising the Incumbent Board shall be, for purposes of this Plan, considered as though such person were a member of the Incumbent Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b)    The consummation of a reorganization, merger or consolidation, in each case, with respect to which persons who were the stockholders of Noble immediately prior to such reorganization, merger or consolidation do not, immediately thereafter, own outstanding voting securities representing at least 51% of the combined voting power entitled to vote generally in the election of directors (Voting Securities) of the reorganized, merged or consolidated company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c)    The stockholders of Noble shall approve a liquidation or dissolution of Noble or a sale of all or substantially all of the stock or assets of Noble; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d)    Any person, as that term is defined in Section 3(a)(9) of the Exchange Act (other than Noble, any of its subsidiaries, any employee benefit plan of Noble or any of its subsidiaries, or any entity organized, appointed or established by Noble for or pursuant to the terms of such a plan), together with all affiliates and associates (as such terms are defined in Rule 12b-2 under the Exchange Act) of such person (as well as any Person or group as those terms are used in Sections 13(d) and 14(d) of the Exchange Act), shall become the beneficial owner or beneficial owners (as defined in Rules 13d-3 and 13d-5 under the Exchange Act), directly or indirectly, of securities of Noble representing in the aggregate 25% or more of either
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the then outstanding shares of Common Stock or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the Voting Securities of Noble, in either such case other than solely as a result of acquisitions of such securities directly from Noble.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Without limiting the foregoing, a person who, directly or indirectly, through any contract, arrangement, understanding, relationship or otherwise has or shares the power to vote, or to direct the voting of, or to dispose, or to direct the disposition of, shares of Common Stock or other Voting Securities of Noble shall be deemed the beneficial owner of such shares or Voting Securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding the foregoing, a Change of Control shall not be deemed to have occurred for purposes of subparagraph (d) of this definition solely as the result of an acquisition of securities by Noble which, by reducing the number of shares of Common Stock or other Voting Securities of Noble outstanding, increases
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the proportionate number of shares of Common Stock beneficially owned by any person to 25% or more of the shares of Common Stock then outstanding or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the proportionate voting power represented by the Voting Securities of Noble beneficially owned by any person to 25% or more of the combined voting power of all then outstanding Voting Securities; provided, however, that if any person referred to in clause
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) of this sentence shall thereafter become the beneficial owner of any additional shares of Common Stock or other Voting Securities of Noble (other than a result of a stock split, stock dividend or similar transaction), then a Change of Control shall be deemed to have occurred for purposes of subparagraph (d) of this definition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.10    Committee means the Compensation, Benefits and Stock Option Committee of the Board or such other committee of the Board as may be designated by the Board to administer the Plan, which committee shall consist of two or more members of the Board each of whom must be an Outside Director.

sentences.text: ARTICLE III.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PLAN ADMINISTRATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3.1 Plan Administrator and Discretionary Authority.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Plan shall be administered by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall have total and exclusive responsibility to control, operate, manage and administer this Plan in accordance with its terms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall have all the authority that may be necessary or helpful to enable it to discharge its responsibilities with respect to this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Without limiting the generality of the preceding sentence, the Committee shall have the exclusive right to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) interpret this Plan and the Award Agreements executed hereunder,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) decide all questions concerning eligibility for, and the amount of, Awards granted under this Plan,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) construe any ambiguous provision of this Plan or any Award Agreement,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) prescribe the form of Award Agreements,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) correct any defect, supply any omission or reconcile any inconsistency in this Plan or any Award Agreement,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) issue administrative guidelines as an aid in administering this Plan and make changes in such guidelines as the Committee from time to time deems proper,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (g) make regulations for carrying out this Plan and make changes in such regulations as the Committee from time to time deems proper,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (h) determine whether Awards should be granted singly or in combination,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) to the extent permitted under this Plan, grant waivers of Plan terms, conditions, restrictions and limitations,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (j) accelerate the exercise, vesting or payment of an Award,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (k) require Participants to hold a stated number or percentage of shares of Common Stock acquired pursuant to an Award for a stated period, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (l) take any and all other actions the Committee deems necessary or advisable for the proper operation or administration of this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall have authority in its sole discretion with respect to all matters related to the discharge of its responsibilities and the exercise of its authority under this Plan, including without limitation its construction of the terms of this Plan and its determination of eligibility for participation in, and the terms of Awards granted under, this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The decisions of the Committee and its actions with respect to this Plan shall be final, conclusive and binding on all persons having or claiming to have any right or interest in or under this Plan, including without limitation Participants and their respective Permitted Transferees, estates, beneficiaries and legal representatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the case of an Award intended to be eligible for the performance-based compensation exemption under Section 162
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (m) of the Code, the Committee shall exercise its discretion consistent with qualifying the Award for such exemption.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the case of an Award intended to be exempt from or compliant with Section 409A, the Committee shall exercise its discretion consistent with such intent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3.2 Delegation of Authority.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall have the authority, in its sole and absolute discretion, to delegate its duties and functions under the Plan to the Chief Executive Officer or other officer of Noble, other members of or committees of the Board or such other agents as it may appoint from time to time, provided the Committee may not delegate its duties where such delegation would
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) violate state corporate law, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) fail to satisfy the 162(m) Requirements with respect to making Awards to, or otherwise with respect to Awards granted to, individuals who are covered employees receiving Awards that are intended to constitute performance-based compensation within the meaning of Section 162(m) of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3.3 Liability; Indemnification.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No member of the Committee, nor any person to whom it has delegated thority, shall be personally liable for any action, interpretation or determination made in good faith with respect to this an or Awards granted hereunder, and each member of the Committee (or delegatee of the Committee) shall be fully demnified and protected by Noble with respect to any liability he may incur with respect to any such action, interpretation  determination, to the maximum extent permitted by applicable law.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a)    Subject to adjustment as provided in Section 4.2, the maximum number of shares of Common Stock that shall be available for grant of Awards under this Plan shall be 29,000,000 shares of Common Stock.

sentences.text: (b)    The maximum aggregate number of shares of Common Stock that may be issued pursuant to Incentive Stock Options is 14,000,000 shares.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum number of shares of Common Stock that may
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Appendix C
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: be subject to Awards (other than Options and SARs) granted under the Plan to any one Participant during a fiscal year is 800,000 shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The limitations provided in this Section 4.1(b) shall be subject to adjustment as provided in Section 4.2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c)    Shares of Common Stock issued pursuant to this Plan may be original issue or treasury shares or any combination of the foregoing, as the Committee, in its sole discretion, shall from time to time determine.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the term of this Plan, Noble will at all times reserve and keep available such number of shares of Common Stock as shall be sufficient to satisfy the requirements of this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If, after reasonable efforts, which efforts shall not include registration of the Plan or Awards under the Securities Act, Noble is unable to obtain authority from any applicable regulatory body, which authorization is deemed necessary by legal counsel for Noble for the lawful issuance of shares under the Plan, Noble shall be relieved of any liability with respect to its failure to issue and sell the shares for which such requisite authority was so deemed necessary unless and until such authority is obtained.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d)    Notwithstanding any provision of this Plan to the contrary, the Board or the Committee shall have the right to substitute or assume awards in connection with mergers, reorganizations, separations or other transactions to which Section 424(a) of the Code or Section 409A applies, provided such substitutions or assumptions are permitted by Section 424 of the Code or Section 409A, as applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4.2 Adjustments for Recapitalizations and Reorganizations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to Article XIII, if there is any change in the number or kind of shares of Common Stock outstanding effected without Noble's receipt of consideration
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) by reason of a stock dividend, spin-off, recapitalization, stock split or combination or exchange of shares,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) by reason of a merger, reorganization or consolidation,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) by reason of a reclassification or change in par value or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) by reason of any other extraordinary or unusual event affecting the outstanding Common Stock as, or if the value of outstanding shares of Common Stock is reduced as a result of a spin-off or Nobles payment of an extraordinary cash dividend, or distribution, or dividend or distribution consisting of any assets of Noble other than cash, the maximum number and kind of shares of Common Stock available for issuance under this Plan, the maximum number and kind of shares of Common Stock for which any individual may receive Awards in any fiscal year or under this Plan, the number and kind of shares of Common Stock covered by outstanding Awards, and the price per share or the applicable market value or performance target of such Awards shall be appropriately adjusted by the Committee to reflect any increase or decrease in the number of, or change in the kind or value of, issued shares of Common Stock to preclude, to the extent practicable, the enlargement or dilution of rights under such Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding the provisions of this Section 4.2,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the number and kind of shares of Common Stock available for issuance as Incentive Stock Options under this Plan shall be adjusted only in accordance with Sections 422 and 424 of the Code, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) outstanding Awards and Award Agreements shall be adjusted in accordance with (A) Sections 422 and 424 of the Code with respect to Incentive Stock Options and (B) Section 409A with respect to Nonqualified Stock Options, SARs and, to the extent applicable, other Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4.3 Adjustments for Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following rules shall apply for the purpose of determining the number of shares of Common Stock available for grant of Awards under this Plan:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a)    Options and SARs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant of Options shall reduce the number of shares of Common Stock available for grant of Awards under this Plan by the number of shares subject to such an Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant of SARs that may be paid or settled only in Common Stock, or in either cash or Common Stock (or a combination thereof), shall reduce the number of shares of Common Stock available for grant of Awards under the Plan by the number of shares of Common Stock subject to such Award, and any shares of Common Stock not delivered upon exercise of such SARs or portion thereof shall not again be available for grant of Awards under this Plan and shall not be added back to the number of shares of Common Stock available for grant under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any grant of SARs or portion thereof that may be paid or settled only for cash shall not affect the number of shares of Common Stock available for grant of Awards under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Appendix C
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b)    Restricted Stock and Stock Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant of Restricted Stock or Stock Awards shall reduce the number of shares of Common Stock available for grant of Awards under this Plan by the product of 2.39 multiplied by the number of shares of Common Stock subject to such an Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c)    Restricted Stock Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant of Restricted Stock Units (including those credited to a Participant in respect of a Dividend Equivalent Unit Right) that may be paid or settled
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) only in Common Stock or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) in either cash or Common Stock shall reduce the number of shares available for grant of Awards under this Plan by the product of 2.39 multiplied by the number of shares subject to such an Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant of Restricted Stock Units that may be paid or settled only for cash shall not affect the number of shares available for grant of Awards under this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d)    Performance Awards and Other Incentive Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant of a Performance Award or Other Incentive Award in the form of Common Stock or that may be paid or settled
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) only in Common Stock or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) in either Common Stock or cash shall reduce the number of shares available for grant of Awards under this Plan by the product of 2.39 multiplied by the number of shares subject to such an Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant of a Performance Award or Other Incentive Award that may be paid or settled only for cash shall not affect the number of shares available for grant of Awards under this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e)    Cancellation, Forfeiture and Termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any Award referred to in Section 4.3
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) (other than an Award that may be paid or settled only for cash) is canceled or forfeited, or terminates, expires or lapses, for any reason, the shares then subject to such Award shall again be available for grant of any Awards under this Plan and shall be added back to the number of shares available for grant on the same numerical basis as was used upon grant to reduce the number of shares available for grant of Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f)    Payment of Exercise Price and Withholding Taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding any provision of this Plan to the contrary, shares
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) tendered (either actually or by attestation) or withheld to satisfy an exercise price or tax withholding obligation pertaining to an Award, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) repurchased by Noble using Option proceeds shall not be available for grant of any Awards under this Plan and shall not be added back to the number of shares available for grant under this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ARTICLE V. ELIGIBILITY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall select Participants from those individuals who are Employees, consultants and other individuals performing services for the Company that, in the opinion of the Committee, are in a position to make a positive contribution to the success of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once a Participant has been selected for an Award by the Committee, the Committee shall determine the type and size of Award to be granted to the Participant and shall establish in the related Award Agreement the terms, conditions, restrictions and limitations applicable to the Award, in addition to those set forth in this Plan and the administrative guidelines and regulations, if any, established by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ARTICLE VI.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FORM OF AWARDS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.1    Form of Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards may be granted under this Plan, in the Committees sole discretion, in the form of Options pursuant to Article VII, SARs pursuant to Article VIII, Restricted Stock pursuant to Article IX, Restricted Stock Units pursuant to Article X, Performance Awards pursuant to Article XI and Stock Awards and Other Incentive Awards pursuant to Article XII, or any combination thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Awards shall be subject to the terms, conditions, restrictions and limitations of this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may, in its sole discretion, subject any Award to such other terms, conditions, restrictions and/or limitations (including without limitation the time and conditions of exercise, vesting or payment of an Award and restrictions on transferability of any shares of Common Stock issued or delivered pursuant to an Award), provided they are not inconsistent with the terms of this Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may, but is not required to, subject an Award to such conditions as it determines are necessary or appropriate to ensure that an Award constitutes qualified performance based compensation within the meaning of Section 162(m) of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards under a particular Article of this Plan need not be uniform, and Awards under more than one Article of this Plan may be combined in a single
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Appendix C
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Award Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any combination of Awards may be granted at one time and on more than one occasion to the same Participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.2    No Repricing or Reload Rights; No Buy-out of Underwater Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except for adjustments made pursuant to Section 4.2, no Award may be repriced, replaced, regranted through cancellation or otherwise modified without stockholder approval, if the effect would be to reduce the exercise price for the shares underlying such Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may not cancel an outstanding Option or SAR having an exercise price that is known to be more than the Fair Market Value of the Common Stock in exchange for a cash payment or for the purpose of granting a replacement Award of a different type.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.3    Dividends, Dividend Equivalent Cash Rights and Dividend Equivalent Unit Rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Award that provides for the payment or accumulation of dividends, Dividend Equivalent Cash Rights or Dividend Equivalent Unit Rights shall allow such dividends, Dividend Equivalent Cash Rights or Dividend Equivalent Unit Rights to vest or otherwise become payable sooner than the date on which the underlying Award or portion thereof with respect to which it was granted has vested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ARTICLE VII.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OPTIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7.1 General.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards may be granted in the form of Options that may be Incentive Stock Options or Nonqualified Stock Options, or any combination of both; provided, however, that Incentive Stock Options may be granted only to Employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7.2 Terms and Conditions of Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An Option shall be exercisable in whole or in such installments and at such times as may be determined by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The price at which a share of Common Stock may be purchased upon exercise of an Option shall be determined by the Committee, but such exercise price shall not be less han 100% of the Fair Market Value per share of Common Stock on the Grant Date unless the Option is granted through he assumption of, or in substitution for, outstanding awards previously granted to individuals who became Employees (or other service providers) as a result of a merger, consolidation, acquisition or other corporate transaction involving the Company in a manner that complies with Section 409A with respect to a Nonqualified Stock Option or Section 422 of the Code with respect to an Incentive Stock Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except as otherwise provided in Section 7.3, the term of each Option shall be as specified by the Committee; provided, however, that no Options shall be exercisable later than 10 years after the Grant Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options may be granted with respect to Restricted Stock or shares of Common Stock that are not Restricted Stock, as determined by the Committee in its sole discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7.3 Restrictions Relating to Incentive Stock Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a)    Options granted in the form of Incentive Stock Options shall, in addition to being subject to the terms and conditions of Section 7.2, comply with Section 422
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent the aggregate Fair Market Value (determined as of the dates the respective Incentive Stock Options are granted) of Common Stock with respect to which Incentive Stock Options are exercisable for the first time by an individual during any calendar year under all incentive stock option plans of Noble and its Affiliates exceeds $100,000, such excess Incentive Stock Options shall be treated as options that do not constitute Incentive Stock Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee shall determine, in accordance with the applicable provisions of the Code, which of a Participants Incentive Stock Options will not constitute Incentive Stock Options because of such limitation and shall notify the Participant of such determination as soon as practicable after such determination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The price at which a share of Common Stock may be purchased upon exercise of an Incentive Stock Option shall be determined by the Committee, but such exercise price shall not be less than 100% of the Fair Market Value of a share of Common Stock on the Grant Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Incentive Stock Option shall be granted to an Employee under this Plan if, at the time such Option is granted, such Employee owns stock possessing more than 10% of the total combined voting power of all classes of stock of Noble or of its Affiliates unless
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) on the Grant Date of such Option, the exercise price of such Option is at least 110% of the Fair Market Value of the Common Stock subject to the Option and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) such Option by its terms is not exercisable after the expiration of five years from the Grant Date of the Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Appendix C
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b)    Each Participant awarded an Incentive Stock Option shall notify Noble in writing immediately after the date he or she makes a disqualifying disposition of any shares of Common Stock acquired pursuant to the exercise of such Incentive Stock Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A disqualifying disposition is any disposition (including any sale) of such Common Stock before the later of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) two years after the Grant Date of the Incentive Stock Option or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) one year after the date of exercise of the Incentive Stock Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7.4 Exercise of Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a)    Subject to the terms and conditions of this Plan, Options shall be exercised by the delivery of a written notice of exercise to Noble, setting forth the number of whole shares of Common Stock with respect to which the Option is to be exercised, accompanied by full payment for such shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b)    Upon exercise of an Option, the exercise price of the Option shall be payable to Noble in full either
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) in cash or an equivalent acceptable to the Committee,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) in the sole discretion of the Committee and in accordance with any applicable administrative guidelines established by the Committee, (A) by tendering (either actually or by attestation) one or more previously acquired nonforfeitable, unrestricted shares of Common Stock having an aggregate Fair Market Value at the time of exercise equal to the total exercise price or (B) by surrendering a sufficient portion of the shares with respect to which the Option is exercised having an aggregate Fair Market Value at the time of exercise equal to the total exercise price or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) in a combination of the forms specified in
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) of this subsection.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c)    To the extent permissible under applicable law, payment of the exercise price of an Option may also be made, in the absolute discretion of the Committee, by delivery to Noble or its designated agent of an executed irrevocable option exercise form together with irrevocable instructions to a broker-dealer to sell or margin a sufficient portion of the shares with respect to which the Option is exercised and deliver the sale or margin loan proceeds directly to Noble to pay the exercise price and any required withholding taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d)    As soon as reasonably practicable after receipt of written notification of exercise of an Option and full payment of the exercise price and any required withholding taxes, Noble shall
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) deliver to the Participant, in the Participants name or the name of the Participants designee, a stock certificate or certificates in an appropriate aggregate amount based upon the number of shares of Common Stock purchased under the Option or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) cause to be issued in the Participants name or the name of the Participants designee, in book-entry form, an appropriate number of shares of Common Stock based upon the number of shares purchased under the Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7.5    Termination of Employment or Service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Award Agreement embodying the Award of an Option may et forth the extent to which the Participant shall have the right to exercise the Option following termination of the articipants employment or service with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such provisions shall be determined by the Committee in its bsolute discretion, need not be uniform among all Options granted under this Plan and may reflect distinctions based on e reasons for termination of employment or service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except to the extent provided otherwise in a Participants Award greement embodying the Award of an Option, the following termination provisions shall apply with respect to such ward:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a)    Termination For Cause.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the employment or service of a Participant shall terminate for Cause, each outstanding Option, whether vested or unvested, held by the Participant shall automatically terminate as of the date of such termination of employment or service, and the right to exercise the Option shall immediately terminate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b)    Termination By Reason of Retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of a Participants Retirement, each outstanding Option held by the Participant shall remain outstanding and may be exercised by the Participant, to the extent vested at the time of the Participants Retirement, until the earlier of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the expiration of five years from the date of such Retirement or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the expiration of the Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent an Option is unvested at the time of the Participants Retirement, the Option shall
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Appendix C
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: automatically terminate as of the date of such Retirement, and the right to exercise the Option shall immediately terminate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c)    Termination By Reason of Death or Disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of a Participants termination of employment or service on account of death or Disability, each outstanding Option, whether vested or unvested, held by the Participant shall remain outstanding and may be exercised by the person who acquires the Option by will or the laws of descent and distribution, or by the Participant, as the case may be, until the earlier of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the expiration of five years from the date of death or termination on account of Disability or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the expiration of the Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d)    Termination For Reasons Other Than Cause, Retirement, Death or Disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a Participants employment or service is terminated under circumstances that are not covered by subsections
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) of this Section 7.5, an Option held by the Participant may be exercised by the Participant, to the extent vested as the time of the Participants termination, until the earlier of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the expiration of one year from the date of such termination or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the expiration of the Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent an Option is unvested at the time of the Participants termination of employment or service, the Option shall automatically terminate as of the date of such termination, and the right to exercise the Option shall immediately terminate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding the foregoing, except in the case of a Participants death, an Option will not be treated as an Incentive Stock Option unless at all times beginning on the Grant Date and ending on the day three months (one year in the case of a Participant who is disabled within the meaning of Section 22
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e)(3) of the Code) before the date of exercise of the Option, the Participant is an employee of Noble or a parent corporation or a subsidiary corporation of Noble, as those erms are defined in Sections 424
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) of the Code, respectively (or a corporation or a parent or subsidiary corporation of such corporation issuing or assuming an option in a transaction to which Section 424(a) of the Code applies).
